reviews.review_msg: Probably one of the best (if not the best) ECON classes at SFU. The class is very interesting. The professor teaches this class perfectly! Chris is a great prof and very knowledgeable. If you participate in class, the 3 hour lecture goes by very fast. 10/10 would definitely recommend!
If you really want take a interactive course that you can share your idea with everyone on what you learnt, take this course.

The best professor in the whole SFU. It was really the wisest choice for me to take this professor's class in the penultimate semester of graduation. Do not miss this professor if you want to learn about development economics theory and improve your economic writing. This professor is extremely patient and responsible for every student.
He is a very nice person and he'd love to help students during his office hours. The materials are not hard if you already took Econ 355w. Highly recommend for 4-level course!!!!
Solid class, interesting topics. Highly recommended.

He's a nice guy while teaching in class, but not when grading assignments. Feedback was very nit picky, doesn't say much or even anything about what was done right, but lots of comments on what was wrong. Avoid him if you can, although he's assigned most teaching duties in the department being a lecturer.
I liked taking the class with him. He is super nice and very approachable. Would recommend taking classes with him.
